conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in Nursery_A. Yes, the place is still currently unfilled.

At this stage, we are reviewing families based on our intake priorities and overall cohort fit (including factors such as start-date alignment, age-group balance, and completion of required documentation). We’re not able to pre-commit or indicate a guaranteed pathway to an offer in advance, as decisions depend on the full pool of candidates engaging with us in the upcoming rounds.

If you would like to be actively considered again, you’re welcome to submit a fresh formal application in a round when you’re ready, and we will review it alongside any other current candidates. If anything has changed since your last application (preferred start date, schedule flexibility, or documents ready), please include that in your note.

Kind regards,
Nursery_A Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful note and for approaching the process so constructively.

At a high level, the main factors that tend to limit offers for the remaining place are (1) alignment with the start-date window we are currently planning for, (2) the specific attendance pattern we are trying to finalize (e.g., full-time vs. a particular set of days), and (3) overall cohort balance for the age group.

Because we are still reviewing the active pool round by round, we aren’t able to give a definitive “if you do X, you will be offered” pathway. That said, if you are able to do a near-term start and can be flexible toward a more consistent weekly pattern (rather than a highly constrained set of days), that generally improves feasibility for planning.

If you’d like, please reply with:
- your earliest possible start date,
- your ideal schedule and your maximum flexibility (which days/hours you can also do), and
- your child’s age / current classroom level needs.

With that information, we can confirm whether your profile fits the constraints we are currently trying to solve for, and you can then decide whether to submit another formal application in a round that makes sense for you.

Kind regards,
Nursery_A Admissions

[TALK]

At this stage, our intention is to keep the place available while we continue to see whether higher-priority families (per our intake priority order) engage and submit a formal [APPLY] in upcoming rounds. Because participation is round-based and can change quickly, we cannot commit to a rule that we will automatically offer the place to the highest-priority applicant who applies in a given round if no higher-priority family applies that same round.
